channel.title: Help would be great
channel.description:
Alright so i've been trying to get my potforwarding to work for the past few weeks. I've spent a good 30+ hours messing with my modem, and my router. I finally figured it out (i think).
Basically i have an embarq 660 series modem (a whore of a router to work with) I found alot of forums and finally figured that it was best to bridge the modem to my linksys router. Once i bridged it and portforwarded i thought i'd be good to go, but of course not. 3 days later, still surfing through the search button and multiple forums i am still stuck. Could someone please help me with the error i'm getting or walk me through this? It would be much appreciated... Here is the error i get when trying to start my server in the EasyRSC v1.1 Control panel.
[code][Error] Cannot assign requested address: bind [Error] [Ljava.lang.StackTraceElement;@2b323e[/code]
In my command prompt i get this...
[code] [java] java.net.BindException: Cannot assign requested address: bind [java] at sun.nio.ch.Net.bind(Native Method) [java] at sun.nio.ch.ServerSocketChannelImpl.bind(Unknown Source) [java] at sun.nio.ch.ServerSocketAdaptor.bind(Unknown Source) [java] at org.apache.mina.transport.socket.nio.SocketAcceptor.registerN ew(SocketAcceptor.java:363) [java] at org.apache.mina.transport.socket.nio.SocketAcceptor.access$80 0(SocketAcceptor.java:55) [java] at org.apache.mina.transport.socket.nio.SocketAcceptor$Worker.ru n(SocketAcceptor.java:222) [java] at org.apache.mina.util.NamePreservingRunnable.run(NamePreservin gRunnable.java:51) [java] at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)[/code]
Any insight to my problem would be amazing. Thanks guys.

item.title: Help would be great
item.dc:creator: @aaronsc aaronsc
item.description:
@aaronsc wrote:

Alright i’ll try and get back to you, thank-you for the information and prompt response :)[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 23, 2009, 12:38:49 am[/size][hr]I’ve adjusted my ports seeing as i’m using XP and not vista, and nothing seemed to work. I tried going up and down with my ports. I never had the problem with hamachi, and if i set it to my static IP in the server.java i don’t get the error, but then people can’t connect. So let me check to make sure i have this correct.

I input my computers IP into the settings file, within the client which i can find from whatismyip.com

and i input my defualt gateway 192.168.1.1 to the server.java file.

After that people should be able to access my server without using hamachi through portforwarding (which i believe i have done correctly after visiting and posting on numberous help sites) …

Read full topic

item.title: Help would be great
item.dc:creator: @Peter Peeter
item.description:
@Peter wrote:

The problem comes from using a port that’s in use. Are you using Vista? Because Vista doesn’t clear the port for some reason.

Basically try the following:
a) FOR VISTA: Goto the taskmanager and kill all java process’. If the error still continues, goto B.
b) Change the port your server is assigned to.

Read full topic

Alright so i’ve been trying to get my potforwarding to work for the past few weeks. I’ve spent a good 30+ hours messing with my modem, and my router. I finally figured it out (i think).
